page.title: 17Housing in Tempsford.
page.content: Since the population of Tempsford has remained static since after the second world war there has been a marked decrease in the number of new homes being built.Any new homes can only be built on an infilling basis that is they take up a space already occupied by a building and build on to it or round it. Homes in Tempsford fall into 1 of 3 groups. 1.The older nut thatched cottages with 17th and 18thC timbers inside,small windows and doors. 2.Modern bungalows built 1960s with dormer windows in the roof and weather boarding on the outer walls. 3.Semi-detatched or terraced brick built houses constructed late 1930s very plain looking and certainly detracts from any picture postcard image of an old English village.
